definition[0]: to examine something again in order to calculate its present value
example[0]: The company’s land has been revalued at £16.9m.
definition[1]: to increase the value of a country’s money in relation to that of other countries
example[1]: The dollar has just been revalued.
definition[2]: to examine something again in order to calculate its current value in relation to other similar things
example[2]: Some properties need to be revalued.
example[3]: They recommended that we should revalue our assets once every five years.
example[4]: speculators who stood to make a profit if the currency was revalued
